1:
Well, I'm not sure I can just hand out money willy-nilly like it's going out of style, but at the same time, I've always believed in treating others with kindness and fairness. As an architect, I strive to create spaces that not only look great but also work efficiently and effectively for everyone who uses them. And what better way to test my skills than by putting myself in a hypothetical financial situation? I think it's only fair that if one of us is going to receive $10 from the study group, the other should receive something more substantial.

But at the same time, as an architect, I'm also passionate about sustainability and functionality. I believe that good design doesn't have to come at the expense of the environment or our wallets. So, while I may not be able to give someone three times my $10, I think it's only fitting that we're trying something new and innovative.

I think if we both had equal parts – say... 50/50 - the $5 difference might not seem like a lot to some people, but for us, it would mean a lot. We could use that money to pay for a small project or an event in our community that benefits everyone involved. That way, our experiment would be more than just about testing a financial equation – it would be about creating something positive and lasting.

Finally, I will give $5
